titleStmt.title: F. M. Webster to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1090

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Newport Ky
Octr 28th 1864
To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Govr of Ky

Herewith please find copies of two Indictments. the accused in which has fled and is at or near st Louis in the State of Mo, as we are satisfactorily informed -- The offenses of which he stands here charged are of a very aggravated character and ^that^ he ought to be brought to justice is the general sentiment here -- I write for the purpose of obtaining the necessary papers
for his arrest and return to this state for trial and would suggest as a suitable and efficient person to act as agent of the state M Cook who is marshal of the city of Newport.
He acted prmptly and efficiently in the same capacity not long ago in bringing a man from Ill, who was indicted in our court --
your attention to the above is respectfully asked --

I am most respectfully &c
F. M. Webster
Pros Atty' of
Newport --

Requisition Governor of IllinoisMissouri for John Henry & M Cook apptd Agent
3d Nov/64
